com.cyc.session

Interface CycSessionConfiguration

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EnvironmentConfiguration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSessionConfigurationProperties, EnvironmentConfigurationLoader.EnvironmentConfigurationImpl, ImmutableConfiguration

    public interface CycSessionConfiguration
    This interface defines the set of configuration parameters used by the Session API to establish a new CycSession.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CycServer getCycServer()
      Returns the address of the Cyc server to be connected to.
      Class getLoaderClass()
      Returns the class of the SessionConfigurationLoader implementation used to instantiate and populate this instance of CycSessionConfiguration.
      String getPolicyFileName()
      Returns the name of a file from which to load configuration information.
      String getPolicyName()
      Returns the name of a requested SessionConfigurationLoader to be used to load a CycSessionConfiguration.
      Properties getRawProperties()
      Returns a copy of the original Properties object used to initialize the CycSessionConfiguration implementation.
      boolean isConfigurationCachingAllowed()
      Is the SessionManager permitted to cache configurations? This is useful when loading configurations is expensive or annoying.
      boolean isEquivalent(CycSessionConfiguration configuration)
      Does this configuration share the same field values with another? Weaker than #equals, as it ignores things like Class and loader Class.
      boolean isGuiInteractionAllowed()
      Does this configuration allow for the end-user to be prompted for configuration properties via GUI elements? If so, and if no other sufficient configuration has specified, and if the application is not running in a headless environment, the Session API may prompt the end-user for configuration information.
      boolean isSessionCachingAllowed()
      Is the SessionManager permitted to cache sessions?

    • Method Detail

      • getCycServer

        CycServer getCycServer()
        Returns the address of the Cyc server to be connected to.
        Returns:
        a CycServer address.

      • getPolicyName

        String getPolicyName()
        Returns the name of a requested SessionConfigurationLoader to be used to load a CycSessionConfiguration. In this way, one could specifically ask for a configuration to be loaded by, say, interactively prompting the user. A SessionConfigurationLoader's name may be determined via SessionConfigurationLoader.getName().
        Returns:
        the name of the requested SessionConfigurationLoader.

      • getPolicyFileName

        String getPolicyFileName()
        Returns the name of a file from which to load configuration information.
        Returns:
        the configuration file name.

      • isGuiInteractionAllowed

        boolean isGuiInteractionAllowed()
        Does this configuration allow for the end-user to be prompted for configuration properties via GUI elements? If so, and if no other sufficient configuration has specified, and if the application is not running in a headless environment, the Session API may prompt the end-user for configuration information.
        Returns:
        is system allowed to prompt end-user for configuration properties via GUI elements?

      • isConfigurationCachingAllowed

        boolean isConfigurationCachingAllowed()
        Is the SessionManager permitted to cache configurations? This is useful when loading configurations is expensive or annoying. If this option is set to false, the SessionManager will attempt to load a configuration for each and every session it creates, which can be fantastically annoying if it is doing so by interactively prompting the user.
        Returns:
        can configurations be cached?

      • isSessionCachingAllowed

        boolean isSessionCachingAllowed()
        Is the SessionManager permitted to cache sessions?
        Returns:
        can sessions be cached?

      • isEquivalent

        boolean isEquivalent(CycSessionConfiguration configuration)
        Does this configuration share the same field values with another? Weaker than #equals, as it ignores things like Class and loader Class.
        Parameters:
        configuration -
        Returns:
        are these two configurations equivalent

      • getLoaderClass

        Class getLoaderClass()
        Returns the class of the SessionConfigurationLoader implementation used to instantiate and populate this instance of CycSessionConfiguration.
        Returns:
        the Class of the SessionConfigurationLoader implementation.

      • getRawProperties

        Properties getRawProperties()
        Returns a copy of the original Properties object used to initialize the CycSessionConfiguration implementation.

        If the implementing class was initialized with a Properties object, this method will return an exact copy of that Properties object. This may mean that it will contain properties which are not used by the Session API; for example, in the case of a CycSessionConfiguration initialized by a call to System.getProperties().

        If the implementing class was not initialized by a Properties object, it is up to the implementation to determine what to return; see the implemention's javadoc.

        Regardless of implementation, this method should never return null; it should always return, at least, an empty Properties object. Each call to this method will return a fresh copy of the Properties; changes to the Properties will not be persisted. Likewise, changing values in the resulting Properties object will not change the values returned by any methods on the CycSessionConfiguration object.

        Returns:
        a non-null Properties object.
